有一說法話 單論同一代晶片 INTEL 設計係好好 但死在自家晶圓廠拖後腳
從前INTEL晶片有優勢算力高 但漸漸要遷就自家晶圓廠 令到要出現擠牙膏
漸漸各家大企業不斷更新自己產品 速度快過INTEL晶片效能
有能力既公司都轉用自家晶片 先有蘋果亞馬遜TESLA 後有微軟GOOGLE 依家聽講FB都可能會
加上台積電、三叔工藝不斷進步 晶圓代工業務不斷豐富
而台積電只係純代工 無同客戶有利益衝突
晶片市場會漸漸擴大 所以覺得不論INTEL 如何 台積電都好好前途

不過有隱憂 佢既產能俾APPLE 食曬 同APPLE榮辱與共

有錯請其他巴絲指正

quote.msg: INTC而家嘗試緊轉型玩data centre，同埋最近出咗獨立GPU unit開拓市場

真係有留意科技發展就知 INTEL 做緊既野係開拓緊成個半導體業既將來，Nvidia AI 係發展得早，但佢地只係用 GPU 去運行AI 既algorithm，INTEL 既HABANA 係專門AI 既芯片，比GPU 快同用電少好多，將來AI 應該都只會用專用芯片去運行，GPU只係輔助。
另外INTEL 開發緊既3D Stacking, Packaging，連TSM 都基本上做唔到。
當3D Stacking去到可以量產，到時你想要幾多個CPU CORE 更本上已經無物理限制，TSM 係勁，但只係佢地玩製程玩到爐火純青，當成個半導體工業而家仲嚮到研究緊3nm 製程打上點做，佢地已經吹話自己做緊2nm，真係人唔笑狗都吠。

3D stacking其實其他廠都有專利
但似乎intel真係領先嗰個嚟，直頭話自己係stack咩都可以

對於AI嘅未來，我覺得nvidia唔會有問題
佢哋同intel u一樣入晒server，要打贏佢難度好高

https://www.thestreet.com/etffocus/trade-ideas/top-5-semiconductor-etfs-2021

The tech sector was once again a top performer in 2020. Semiconductor stocks were a big reason for that as the sector returned more than 50% this year.

Semiconductors proved to be an economically resilient sector in 2020. Despite disruptions related to the COVID pandemic, semiconductor sales were up more than 5% this year. They're also forecast to increase another 8% in 2021.

If the COVID vaccine does what we hope it will and it ushers in a global economic recovery, the tech sector (and semiconductors specifically) could be poised to lead the market again.

Here are 5 top semiconductor ETFs to consider in 2021.

iShares PHLX Semiconductor ETF (SOXX)

SOXX is easily the largest semiconductor-focused ETF and one of the most broadly diversified. It invests in companies engaged in the design, distribution, manufacture and sale of semiconductors.

The fund skews heavily towards large-cap stocks and gives larger allocations to companies with greater semiconductor industry exposure.

VanEck Vectors Semiconductor ETF (SMH)

SMH also focuses on large-cap stocks, but takes a more global approach to portfolio construction. It's only got about 75% of assets dedicated to U.S. stocks.

It's also one of the more concentrated portfolios. SMH holds only about 25 names at a time.

SPDR S&P Semiconductor ETF (XSD)

XSD can invest in large-, mid- and small-cap stocks, so it tends to have more of a small company skew than the other ETFs on this list.

Another unique characteristic is the fact that the portfolio is equal-weighted, something that none of the other funds on this list does.

Invesco Dynamic Semiconductors ETF (PSI)

PSI doesn't aim to provide a broad semiconductor stock portfolio. It tries to identify the best. It evaluates companies based on a variety of criteria, including price momentum, earnings momentum, quality, management action and value.
The fund is also fairly concentrated by investing in just 30 U.S. companies.

First Trust Nasdaq Semiconductor ETF (FTXL)

FTXL takes a similar approach by focus on quality. It targets the 30 most liquid stocks from the sector and then examines their 12-month price volatility, cash flow to price and recent growth rates.

The securities are then weighted according to their combined metric scores with top scores earning greater weights.

相比之下，2020年第三季度，台積電營收為121.4億美元，創曆史新高。毛利潤率為53.4%，高於上一季度的53%。

之前，台積電已經公布了2020年第四季度的前兩個月營收。其中，10月份營收為1193.03億新台幣，11月份營收為1248.65億，兩個月合計營收2441.68億新台幣（約合87億美元）。

台積電12月銷售額1173.7億新台幣，同比增長14%。台積電第四季度銷售額3615.4億新台幣，市場預期為3640億新台幣。

英特爾已經與台積電和三星電子進行過會談，打算請亞洲公司幫助生產一些最好的晶片，但這家矽谷領軍企業仍希望自己的生產能力在最後時刻能有提高。

知情人士說，在自家晶片製造工藝的提高不斷被延誤之後，總部位於加州聖克拉拉的英特爾依然沒有做出最終決定，而此刻距離原定的計畫宣布之日已不到兩周。不願具名的知情人士說，英特爾可能從台灣採購的任何元器件最早要等到2023年才會上市，並且將基於其他台積電客戶已經使用的既定製造工藝。

知情人士說，英特爾與三星的談判處於更初級階段。三星的生產能力不如台積電。台積電和三星的代表均拒絕置評。英特爾發言人建議記者參考該公司執行長Bob Swan以前的評論。

Swan已向投資者許諾，他將制定外包計畫，並在1月21日該公司發布財報時讓英特爾的生產技術回到正軌。這家世界上最著名的晶片製造商歷來在先進製造技術方面處於業界領先地位，這對於保持現代半導體性能提高的步伐至關重要。但是該公司遭遇長達數年的延誤，使它落後於那些自己設計晶片、交給台積電代工的競爭對手。

An Interview with Intel CEO Bob Swan: Roundtable Q&A on Fabs and Future

https://www.anandtech.com/show/16360/an-interview-with-intel-ceo-bob-swan-roundtable-qa-on-fabs-and-future


Paul Alcorn: Is there scope for Intel to consider sub-licensing leading process node technology from other foundries in order to use in its own manufacturing facilities?

Bob Swan: Possibly. I think the strategically for Intel, the ecosystem has evolved over the last 10 years. If there are ways or opportunities to leverage other industry advancements, then it is going to be very front-and-center for Intel to capitalize on industry innovations. Intel is coming to the realization that we don't have to do all the innovations ourselves. So in that thought we might outsource, we might move to using third party IP, opening up our own manufacturing and become a foundry. Is there a scenario in which Intel might use another’s process technology in our own manufacturing? That's certainly possible. The industry is evolving and we need to leverage that innovation, within our walls or elsewhere, and take advantage.

copy漏咗

Paul Alcorn, Tom’s Hardware: One of the key benefits of Intel is that it manages its own manufacturing supply chain, however recently Intel has discussed using external suppliers for key components. We're moving into an era, due to COVID and other political relations, where the scope for a sustained third-party supply might leave Intel on the back foot should it decide to outsource its market leading products. How does Intel move forward in a future where it blends its product lines with a mix of third-party derivatives, the supply and economics of which will be further removed from Intel's usual control?

Swan:
...
For Intel, this is our advantage as an IDM (Integrated Device Manufacturer). While an IDM is still dependent on its ecosystem, it helps being the allocator rather than the allocatee - it means a great deal. If we think about design disaggregation, where we might leverage a third party foundry process, in any discussions that we are trying, even if we don't make those agreements happen, we always have to look at how we preserve the advantages of being a [vertically integrated] IDM. This means the ability to leverage Intel's size and scale, especially to get preferential treatment when allocation decisions are being made. We've got practice in using third party resources for our commodities, and as we plan to expand and use more third party foundries, maintaining and securing the advantages to Intel’s IDM strategy is going to be critical

Advanced Micro Devices Q4 Earnings
- Q4 Adj. EPS $0.52 (est $0.47)
- Q4 Revenue $3.20 Bln (est $2.73 Bln)
- Sees 2021 Adj. Gross Margin Around 47% (est 46.6%)
- AMD's revenue was up 53% Y/Y in Q4 and 45% over the whole of 2020
- For the whole of 2020, AMD generated free cash flow of $777M. That's up sharply from 2019's $276M.
- AMD's guidance for 2021 revenue growth is 37%
- Third-gen Epyc server CPU line (Milan) will officially launch in March
- AMD notes its desktop CPU sales rose Q/Q and Y/Y
- $3.2 billion in revenue this quarter, up 53 percent from $2.1 billion last quarter
- $1.78 billion in profit this quarter, up 948 percent from $170 million last quarter*
- $9.76 billion in revenue this past year, up 45 percent from $6.7 billion in 2019
- $2.49 billion in profit this past year, up 630 percent from $341 million in 2019*

AMD Earnings call重點︰

- AMD ramped production for 20+ 7nm products during the year.
- AMD processor revenue rose more than 50%.
- Desktop CPU sales rose by a strong double-digit percentage
- Notebook processor sales also rose by a double-digit %
- Server processor sales more than doubled Y/Y in 2020, and total data center sales are now a high-teens % of total revenue.
- GPU sales were up and the demand is very strong
- The number of AMD-powered cloud computing instances more than doubled last year to more than 200.
- AMD remains on track to close the Xilinx deal by the end of 2021
- Inventory rose 8% Q/Q in Q4 in preparation of expected 2021 sales
- Opex fell to 28% of revenue in 2020 from 31% in 2019 thanks to revenue growth.
- PC and console markets being stronger than seasonality in Q1 2021.
- AMD 3 gen EPYC Milan would be the main focus in 2021.
- Expecting significant growth in server CPUs, as well as growth in PCs and semi-custom. Also see growth in GPUs.
- Supply capacity should improve later in the year.

ARK Big Ideas Report 2021
https://ark-invest.com/big-ideas-2021/









https://buzzorange.com/techorange/2021/01/29/catherine-wood-technology-forecast-ark-big-ideas/

趨勢一：「ARM 服務器」營收增長 100 倍
首先就從暴擊英特爾開始。

伍德認為，ARM、RISC-V 和 GPU 將成為主流的處理器，英特爾時代將被終結。

以 ARM 與 x86 為例。首先在市場份額上。

2020 年，ARM 處理器市佔率僅 0.1%，但到 2030 年，ARM 處理器則將直接躍升至 82%。

目前，蘋果、微軟等 PC 都在加緊努力支持 ARM 處理器。

然後在營收上，2030 年，ARM 服務器的營收可能會增長 100 倍。從 2020 年的不到 10 億美元增長到 2030 年的 1000 億美元，營收水準比現在的 x86 更高。

RISC-V 和 ARM 兩大架構的數據中心 CPU 營收將以 45% 的年複合增長率，在 2030 年擴大到 190 億美元。


趨勢二：「AI 晶片」市場規模增長 4 倍
深度學習是伍德欽點的第一個技術領域。

作為一些像智慧音箱、自動駕駛、消費類 App 的技術基石，伍德認為，它所創造的價值要比當年的網路起飛時代要多得多。

未來 15-20 年，深度學習領域將為全球股票市場增加 30 萬億美元的市值。

具體來說，AI 晶片將迎來熱潮，其支出將增長四倍以上，從當前的 50 億美元到 2025 年的 220 億美元。

影響晶片熱潮的因素之一，是 AI 模型訓練成本的陡增。伍德認為，未來 AI 模型訓練成本將在 GPT-3 基礎上增加 100 倍，達到億元的規模。
